results.content: I'm so grateful that I found this course. I'm learning so much and at such a fast rate. Would strongly recommend for any beginner looking to dive into rapid web development and deployment.
results.content_html: I'm so grateful that I found this course. I'm learning so much and at such a fast rate. Would strongly recommend for any beginner looking to dive into rapid web development and deployment.

results.content: Great visuals and explanations.  I too use Anaconda, and many tutorials do not cover this aspect of creating a Django environment (not 100% sure what all of the packages we installed in addition are for, but this question will be answered presumably later in the course).
results.content_html: Great visuals and explanations. I too use Anaconda, and many tutorials do not cover this aspect of creating a Django environment (not 100% sure what all of the packages we installed in addition are for, but this question will be answered presumably later in the course).

results.content: Pretty good start to the topic. I like the pacing and by the end I was able to jump ahead as the methodology became apparent. I also liked the inclusive approach of using anaconda, vscode, html and css as it helps with seeing how everything comes together inside the django project.
results.content_html: Pretty good start to the topic. I like the pacing and by the end I was able to jump ahead as the methodology became apparent. I also liked the inclusive approach of using anaconda, vscode, html and css as it helps with seeing how everything comes together inside the django project.

results.content: The course itself is good when you are looking for a first impression of Django and what you can do. The speed is good. Sometimes even to fast because many topics are not more explained. What should not be mentioned is Anaconda. It all comes to using VSCode. VSCode is with the Linux version of Anaconda not included. So if you as a Linux user have installed VSCode separately on your computer, you are good to go. But don't expect anything to be explained about Anaconda. The main reason for me in giving only 3 stars. The course is also good to follow with any other editor. Like PyCharm, SublimeText or Eric6. Only you need to do some minor things different.
results.content_html: The course itself is good when you are looking for a first impression of Django and what you can do. The speed is good. So if you as a Linux user have installed VSCode separately on your computer, you are good to go. But don't expect anything to be explained about Anaconda. The main reason for me in giving only 3 stars. The course is also good to follow with any other editor. Like PyCharm, SublimeText or Eric6. Only you need to do some minor things different.
